page.title: 10WOLSTON CHILD'S SCHOOLDAY 2.
page.content: After lunch we go in the{playground for a little while. Two dinner ladies look after us and we can skip, play football, climb on the frame or play with our own toys. In the afternoons, we do work again and perhaps sew, or do cooking or play the recorder or guitar depending on the day. So that the whole school can get together, the children from the Annexe have to walk down to the Brookside building on two afternoons of the week. First we do our{physical education}as there is no big apparatus at the Annexe, and then we have{assembly}all together - sometimes children take assembly for their parennts and sometimes visitors or teachers talk to us and tell us interesting things. After school there is sometimes a{bookshop}and we can buy books with our money or with savings stamps which we buy on Tuedays.
